content:
## MARKET OVERVIEW

1. What is the Current Market Regime?
CAUTION regime: low volatility (Vol: 13.1%) but narrow participation with breadth 2/8, signalling low-volatility, high-concentration risk. Expect continuation of narrow rallies and sharp reversals in outliers.

2. Which sectors are leading?
Construction & REIT and Energy & Chemicals are leading: ALARK (1W: +4.49% | 1M: +9.86%) ABOVE TREND, EKGYO (1W: +3.55% | 1M: -0.10%) RECOVERY, ENKAI (1W: +1.53% | 1M: +0.25%) ABOVE TREND; GUBRF (1W: +10.93% | 1M: +13.18%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +3.98% | 1M: +16.58%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +3.76% | 1M: +5.91%) ABOVE TREND.

3. Which sectors are lagging?
Technology & Telecom, Transportation and Banking are lagging with broad weakness: KONTR (1W: -10.89% | 1M: -66.72%) BELOW TREND, TCELL (1W: -3.92% | 1M: +2.58%) CORRECTION; PGSUS (1W: -4.53% | 1M: +0.74%) CORRECTION, THYAO (1W: -3.34% | 1M: -1.65%) BELOW TREND; AKBNK (1W: -3.55% | 1M: +8.63%) CORRECTION, ISCTR (1W: -3.50% | 1M: +1.42%) CORRECTION.

## STOCK PERFORMANCE

4. Top Performing Stocks?
Top five: GUBRF (1W: +10.93% | 1M: +13.18%) ABOVE TREND, ASELS (1W: +7.11% | 1M: +22.55%) ABOVE TREND, ALARK (1W: +4.49% | 1M: +9.86%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +3.98% | 1M: +16.58%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +3.76% | 1M: +5.91%) ABOVE TREND.

5. Worst Performing Stocks?
Bottom five: KONTR (1W: -10.89% | 1M: -66.72%) BELOW TREND, KRDMD (1W: -6.12% | 1M: +4.57%) CORRECTION, PGSUS (1W: -4.53% | 1M: +0.74%) CORRECTION, YKBNK (1W: -4.51% | 1M: +0.40%) CORRECTION, VESTL (1W: -4.39% | 1M: -10.56%) BELOW TREND.

6. Momentum Stocks?
Highest momentum names are GUBRF (1W: +10.93% | 1M: +13.18%) ABOVE TREND, ASELS (1W: +7.11% | 1M: +22.55%) ABOVE TREND, KONTR (1W: -10.89% | 1M: -66.72%) BELOW TREND, KRDMD (1W: -6.12% | 1M: +4.57%) CORRECTION, ALARK (1W: +4.49% | 1M: +9.86%) ABOVE TREND.

## SECTOR OUTLOOK

7. Banking Sector Outlook?
Banking shows defensive dispersion and is weak overall; sector 1W: -2.23%. Key names: HALKB (1W: +3.47% | 1M: +7.13%) ABOVE TREND, AKBNK (1W: -3.55% | 1M: +8.63%) CORRECTION, ISCTR (1W: -3.50% | 1M: +1.42%) CORRECTION, TSKB (1W: -4.21% | 1M: -2.72%) BELOW TREND.

8. Industrial Sector Outlook?
Heavy industry mixed with select strength in defense and autos but broad softness; sector 1W: -0.65%. ASELS (1W: +7.11% | 1M: +22.55%) ABOVE TREND and TOASO (1W: +3.22% | 1M: +9.12%) ABOVE TREND lead, while EREGL (1W: -2.93% | 1M: -0.17%) BELOW TREND and VESTL (1W: -4.39% | 1M: -10.56%) BELOW TREND lag.

9. Energy & Chemicals Outlook?
Energy shows selective strength led by refiners and metal recycling names; sector 1W: +1.40%. GUBRF (1W: +10.93% | 1M: +13.18%) ABOVE TREND, TRALT (1W: +3.98% | 1M: +16.58%) ABOVE TREND, TRMET (1W: +3.76% | 1M: +5.91%) ABOVE TREND, while TUPRS (1W: +0.27% | 1M: -4.69%) RECOVERY is less convincing.

## PORTFOLIO STRATEGY

10. Portfolio Recommendation?
Adopt a cautious, high-conviction stance: overweight leading pockets in Construction & REIT and selective Energy names, trim broad banking/tech exposure and low-conviction holdings. Keep liquidity for rotation risk and tighten stop-losses on high-volatility laggards.

## NEXT WEEK OUTLOOK

11. Stocks to Watch Next Week?
Watch GUBRF (1W: +10.93% | 1M: +13.18%) ABOVE TREND for follow-through, ASELS (1W: +7.11% | 1M: +22.55%) ABOVE TREND for momentum continuation, KONTR (1W: -10.89% | 1M: -66.72%) BELOW TREND for volatility and short-cover risk, AKBNK (1W: -3.55% | 1M: +8.63%) CORRECTION for bank flows, and EKGYO (1W: +3.55% | 1M: -0.10%) RECOVERY for short-term bounce.

12. Sectors to Watch Next Week?
Monitor Construction & REIT and Energy & Chemicals for continuation, and Technology & Telecom for downside risk and volatility spillovers. Pay attention to banking flows as a barometer for market breadth.

13. Key Levels & Triggers?
Watch XU100 trading range behavior around this week's highs and lows for confirmation of breadth expansion, with catalysts being FX moves, central bank commentary, Q4 earnings and commodity price swings. Market direction will hinge on whether leaders sustain gains and whether breadth widens beyond current 2/8.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
Cautionary environment: low volatility but narrow breadth (Vol 13.1%, breadth 2/8), favouring high-conviction longs in Construction & REIT and selective Energy while trimming broad-cap financial and tech exposure. Key risk is sudden breadth deterioration as laggards resume weak flows; key opportunity is exploiting momentum in outliers like GUBRF and ASELS.
